questions.question_text: Which two authentication methods are available in the Workspace ONE UEM console? (Choose two.)

comments.content: I totally agree. The question talks about UEM and not Access. The provided documentation link is also no correct

discussion.content: I think it's A&B because we're talking about the UEM Console and not Access authentication.

comments.content: The correct ans are D and E

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer D - AirWatch Cloud Connector

Here is the updated link (to VMware docs):
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2008/AirWatch_Cloud_Connector/GUID-AWT-UPGRADE-OVERVIEW.html

"VMware AirWatch Cloud Connector is set to auto-update by default. This toggle is available in the UEM console. Auto-update allows VMware AirWatch Cloud Connector to upgrade automatically to the latest version without any user intervention by querying Workspace ONE UEM for newer versions of VMware AirWatch Cloud Connector. "

comments.content: Based on the URL you entered, shouldn't the answer be D?
Lol. I agree, in my experience, the answer should be D.
Yes the answer should be D

questions.question_text: Which auxiliary component, with a default configuration, has the ability to self-update after an upgrade?

comments.content: I agree. Email address enrollment requires autodiscovery configured.
I agree as auto discovery is required for email enrollment

I Agree, according to your provided Link:
"...Configure Autodiscovery Enrollment from a Parent Organization Group
Autodiscovery Enrollment simplifies the enrollment process enrolling devices to intended environments and organization groups (OG) using end-user email addresses...." 

"...Instruct end users who enroll themselves to select the email address option for authentication, instead of entering an environment URL and Group ID. When users enroll devices with an email address..."

discussion.content:
Correct answer is C.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/services/UEM_Managing_Devices/GUID-AWT-AUTODISCOVERYENROLLMENT.html 

Enrollment token is used for enrolling registered devices only. If you restrict enrollment to registered devices only, you also have the option of requiring a registration token to be used for enrollment. This increases security by confirming that a particular user is authorized to enroll. You can send an email or SMS message with the enrollment token attached to users with Workspace ONE UEM accounts.

Selected Answer: C
Auto Discovery is email based - C

questions.question_text:
During an enrollment attempt, a user enters their email address in the initial field in the Intelligent Hub. The user receives an error stating, "Something went wrong with discovery".
Which configuration setting can be enabled to allow end users to enter an email address instead of a Server URL?

comments.content: I agree. AirWatch Cloud Messaging and AirWatch API Components are already installed in a SaaS environment. I admit I don't know about WS1 Adaptive Connector but Cloud Connector makes more sense to me.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A - AirWatch Cloud Connector

it is also misspelled moderator "AitWatch Cloud Connector"

questions.question_text: Which is highly recommended to be installed for discovery services integration in a Software as a Service environment (SaaS)?
When Single Logout (SLO) is disabled in a third party identity provider configuration of Workspace ONE Access, what is the default action taken upon a user signing out of Workspace ONE Access?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
If Enable Single Sign-out is NOT enabled (Disabled), the default configuration in the Workspace ONE Access service is to directed users back to the Workspace ONE portal sign-in page when they sign out. The third-party IDP session might still be open.

According to the same Reference Link, the correct answer should be C: The user is redirected to a custom URL provided in the identity provider configuration

 The Doc says: "...If the third-party IDP (Identity Provider - Thir Party Provider) does not support SAML-based single logout (SLO), you enable single sign-out, and in the Redirect URL text box designate an IDP single logout endpoint URL"

 I think that D could be correct if the question talking about "Single Sign-Out Disabled", cause doc says: "... If Enable Single Sign-out is not enabled, the default configuration in the Workspace ONE Access service is to directed users back to the Workspace ONE portal sign-in page when they sign out..."

choices.A: The user is redirected back to the Workspace ONE Access catalog.
choices.D: The user is redirected to the default Workspace ONE Access login page.
choices.B: The user is redirected to the third party identity provider URL provided in metadata.
choices.C: The user is redirected to a custom URL provided in the identity provider configuration.
